Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2013 09:40AM - edited Oct 14, 2013 09:43AM by summerwinds I wonder why survival rate of lumpectomy would be same or higher then a mastectomy? thanks for the info that lumpectomies cost more...as like the majority , I walked into this situation with no knowledge at all...
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy summerwinds Cougarlicious

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2013 08:39AM summerwinds wrote: Hi I just got my oncotype score also and I scored 47.....I'm 51.....stage 2, no nodes...ER positive....will be on tamoxifin for the next 10 years.... am I happy I had the test, for research yes, for me no....Having a double mastectomy in just over a week....considering a hysterectomy down the road as well... unfortunately I have a very unsupportive husband so that hasn't helped my everyday life during this journey.... Summer
